articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Competency exam ordered in 1976 murder case in Wisconsin
articles.description: A competency exam has been ordered for a man accused of killing a couple in a Wisconsin park in 1976
articles.content:
MARINETTE, Wis. -- 
A competency exam has been ordered for a man accused of killing a couple in a Wisconsin park in 1976.
Raymand Vannieuwenhoven, 82, is charged with two counts of first-degree murder in the deaths of 25-year-old David Schuldes and 24-year-… [+808 chars]

articles.title: Defense Secretary Esper privately warned lawmakers against debating war powers
articles.description: Defense Secretary Esper privately warned lawmakers against debating war powers go.com
articles.content:
On the eve of a House vote Thursday, Defense Secretary Mark Esper urged Congress not to debate limits to President Donald Trumps power to strike Iran because doing so might embolden Tehran and hurt U.S. troops, multiple sources tell ABC News.

articles.title: Ex-town clerk praised for tornado work is accused of theft
articles.description: A former village clerk who was praised for her work in helping rebuild her northeast Nebraska community following a 2014 tornado strike has been accused of theft. Kimberly Neiman was arrested Wednesday at her home in Pilger
articles.content:

articles.title: Wrongfully convicted Georgia man freed after 17 years
articles.description: A Georgia man has been released from prison after spending more than a third of his life incarcerated for a crime he didn't commit
articles.content:
DOUGLAS, Ga. -- 
A Georgia man has been released from prison after spending more than a third of his life incarcerated for a crime he didn't commit.

articles.title: Austria's Kurz backs justice minister against online hate
articles.description: Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz has offered his “full support” to the country's new justice minister in the face of online hatred
articles.content:

Austrian Chancellor Sebastian Kurz offered his full support on Thursday to the country's new justice minister in the face of online hatred over her Bosnian origins.

articles.title: UK interest rates could be cut soon, central banker hints
articles.description: The outgoing head of the Bank of England has hinted that U.K. interest rates could be cut as soon as this month to shore up the economy even as some of the Brexit uncertainty has dissipated
articles.content:
LONDON -- 
U.K. interest rates could be cut as soon as this month to shore up an economy that's barely growing even as some Brexit uncertainty has dissipated, the Bank of England's outgoing chief hinted Thursday.
